null.verse 43:47: Maar toen hij met Onze tekenen tot hen kwam, ziet, bespotten zij hem.
null.verse 43:48: En Wij toonden hun geen teken of het ene was groter dan het andere en Wij deden hen een straf ondergaan opdat zij zich mochten bekeren.
null.verse 43:49: En zij zeiden (tot Mozes): "O, gij tovenaar, bid voor ons tot uw Heer overeenkomstig het verdrag dat Hij met u heeft gesloten, wij zullen zeker de leiding volgen.
null.verse 43:50: Maar toen Wij de straf van hen wegnamen, ziet, zij braken hun woord.
null.verse 43:51: En Pharao riep tot zijn volk: "O, mijn volk! Behoort het koninkrijk van Egypte niet aan mij toe? En stromen deze rivieren niet op mijn bevel? Kunt, gij dat niet inzien?
null.verse 43:52: Of ben ik niet beter dan deze onaanzienlijke man die zich nauwelijks kan uitdrukken?
null.verse 43:53: Waarom zijn hem dan geen armbanden van goud geschonken of komen engelen niet in processie met hem?"
null.verse 43:54: Zo maakte hij zijn volk tot dwazen en zij gehoorzaamden hem.
null.verse 43:55: Toen zij Ons vertoornden, straften Wij hen en verdronken hen allen.
null.verse 43:56: Wij deden hen vergaan en maakten dit tot een voorbeeld voor de komende (geslachten).
null.verse 43:57: En wanneer de zoon van Maria als voorbeeld wordt genoemd, ziet, uw volk rijst op en keerde zich of in ofschuw.
null.verse 43:58: En zij roepen: "Zijn onze goden beter of is hij beter?" Zij zeggen dit tot u alleen om te twisten.
null.verse 43:59: Hij (Jezus) is niets dan een dienaar wie Wij Onze gunst schonken en Wij stelden hem tot voorbeeld voor de kinderen van Israël.
null.verse 43:60: En indien Wij het wilden, konden Wij engelen uit uw midden tot opvolgers op aarde maken.
null.verse 43:61: Maar dit is een teken van het Uur.
null.verse 43:62: En laat Satan u niet verleiden.
null.verse 43:63: Toen Jezus met duidelijke bewijzen kwam, zeide hij: "Waarlijk ik ben met wijsheid tot u gekomen opdat ik u iets van hetgeen waarover gij onderling verschilt duidelijk moge maken.
null.verse 43:64: Voorwaar, God is mijn Heer en uw Heer.
null.verse 43:65: Maar vele groepen uit hun midden werden onenig.
null.verse 43:66: Zij wachten slechts tot het Uur plotseling over hen komt, terwijl zij het niet voorzien.
null.verse 43:67: Vrienden zullen op die Dag elkanders vijanden zijn.
null.verse 43:68: "O Mijn dienaren, geen vrees zal op deze Dag over u komen noch zult gij treuren.
null.verse 43:69: Die in Onze tekenen geloofdet en onderdanig waart,
null.verse 43:70: Gaat het paradijs binnen, gji en uw echtgenoten, gelukkig zijnde.
null.verse 43:71: Er zullen gouden schalen en bekers worden rondgereikt en er zal daarin alles zijn wat de zielen zich wensen en waar de ogen van genieten.
null.verse 43:72: Dit is de Tuin, die u is gegeven (als beloning) voor hetgeen gij deedt.
null.verse 43:73: Er is daarin een overvloed van fruit voor u waarvan gij kunt eten.
null.verse 43:74: De schuldigen zullen gewis de kastijding der hel blijven ondergaan.
null.verse 43:75: En deze zal voor hen niet verlicht worden en zij zullen daarin vertwijfelen.
null.verse 43:76: Wij deden hun geen onrecht, doch zij waren tet die zichzelf onrecht plachten te doen.
null.verse 43:77: En zij zullen schreeuwen: "O, Malik, laat uw Heer een einde aan ons maken.
null.verse 43:78: Wij brachten u zeker de Waarheid maar de meesten uwer waren er afkerig van.
null.verse 43:79: Hebben zij een richting bepaald? Dan doen Wij dat ook.
null.verse 43:80: Denken zij dat Wij hun heimelijk overleg en hun beraadslaging niet horen? Ja zeker! Onze boodschappers bij hen schrijven alles op.
null.verse 43:81: Indien de Barmhartige een zoon had, dan zou ik de eerste der aanbidders zijn.
null.verse 43:82: Verheven is de Heer der hemelen en der aarde, de Heer van de Troon, boven al hetgeen zij vertellen.
null.verse 43:83: Laat hen praten en zich vermaken totdat de Dag komt die hun is beloofd.
null.verse 43:84: En Hij is God in de hemel en op aarde en Hij is de Alwijze, de Alwetende,
null.verse 43:85: En zalig is Hij, Wie het Koninkrijk der hemelen en der aarde en alles, wat er tussen is, toebehoort, en bij Hem is de kennis van het Uur, en tot Hem zult gij worden teruggebracht.
null.verse 43:86: En degenen die zij naast God aanroepen bezitten geen macht tot bemiddeling, behalve hij, die de Waarheid getuigt; en dat weten zij.
null.verse 43:87: En indien gji hun vraagt: "Wie schiep hen?", zullen zij zeker zeggen: "God".
null.verse 43:88: En zijn (des Profeten) gezegde: "O, mijn Heer, dit is een volk dat niet gelooft.
null.verse 43:89: Wend u dan van hen af en zeg: "Vrede": en weldra zullen zij (hun dwaijling) te weten komen.

Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:2: By the Scripture which maketh plain,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:3: Lo! We have appointed it a Lecture, in Arabic that haply ye may understand.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:4: And Lo! in the Source of Decrees, which We possess, it is indeed sublime, decisive.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:5: Shall We utterly ignore you because ye are a wanton folk ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:6: How many a prophet did We send among the men of old!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:7: And never came there unto them a prophet but they used to mock him.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:8: Then We destroyed men mightier than these in prowess; and the example of the men of old hath gone (before them).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:9: And if thou (Muhammad) ask them: Who created the heavens and the earth, they will surely answer: The Mighty, the Knower created them;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:10: Who made the earth a resting-place for you, and placed roads for you therein, that haply ye may find your way;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:11: And Who sendeth down water from the sky in (due) measure, and We revive a dead land therewith.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:12: He Who created all the pairs, and appointed for you ships and cattle whereupon ye ride.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:13: That ye may mount upon their backs, and may remember your Lord’s favour when ye mount thereon, and may say: Glorified be He Who hath subdued these unto us, and we were not capable (of subduing them);
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:14: And lo! unto our Lord we surely are returning.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:15: And they allot to Him a portion of His bondmen! Lo! man is verily a mere ingrate.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:16: Or chooseth He daughters of all that He hath created, and honoureth He you with sons ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:17: And if one of them hath tidings of that which he likeneth to the Beneficent One, his countenance becometh black and he is full of inward rage.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:18: (Liken they then to Allah) that which is bred up in outward show, and in dispute cannot make itself plain ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:19: And they make the angels, who are the slaves of the Beneficent, females.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:20: And they say: If the Beneficent One had (so) willed, we should not have worshipped them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:21: Or have We given them any scripture before (this Qur’an) so that they are holding fast thereto ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:22: Nay, for they say only: Lo! we found our fathers following a religion, and we are guided by their footprints.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:23: And even so We sent not a warner before thee (Muhammad) into any township but its luxurious ones said: Lo! we found our fathers following a religion, and we are following their footprints.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:24: (And the warner) said: What! Even though I bring you better guidance than that ye found your fathers following ? They answered: Lo! in what ye bring we are disbelievers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:26: And when Abraham said unto his father and his folk: Lo! I am innocent of what ye worship
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:27: Save Him Who did create me, for He will surely guide me.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:28: And he made it a word enduring among his seed, that haply they might return.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:29: Nay, but I let these and their fathers enjoy life (only) till there should come unto them the Truth and a messenger making plain.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:30: And now that the Truth hath come unto them they say: This is mere magic, and lo! we are disbelievers therein.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:31: And they say: If only this Qur’an had been revealed to some great man of the two towns ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:32: Is it they who apportion thy Lord’s mercy ? We have apportioned among them their livelihood in the life of the world, and raised some of them above others in rank that some of them may take labour from others; and the mercy of thy Lord is better than (the wealth) that they amass.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:33: And were it not that mankind would have become one community, We might well have appointed, for those who disbelieve in the Beneficent, roofs of silver for their houses and stairs (of silver) whereby to mount,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:34: And for their houses doors (of silver) and couches of silver whereon to recline,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:36: And he whose sight is dim to the remembrance of the Beneficent, We assign unto him a devil who becometh his comrade;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:37: And lo! they surely turn them from the way of Allah, and yet they deem that they are rightly guided;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:38: Till, when he cometh unto Us, he saith (unto his comrade): Ah, would that between me and thee there were the distance of the two horizons - an evil comrade!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:39: And it profiteth you not this day, because ye did wrong, that ye will be sharers in the doom.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:40: Canst thou (Muhammad) make the deaf to hear, or canst thou guide the blind or him who is in error manifest ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:41: And if We take thee away, We surely shall take vengeance on them,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:42: Or (if) We show thee that wherewith We threaten them; for lo! We have complete command of them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:43: So hold thou fast to that which is inspired in thee.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:44: And lo! it is in truth a Reminder for thee and for thy folk; and ye will be questioned.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:45: And ask those of Our messengers whom We sent before thee: Did We ever appoint gods to be worshipped beside the Beneficent ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:46: And verily We sent Moses with Our revelations unto Pharaoh and his chiefs, and he said: I am a messenger of the Lord of the Worlds.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:47: But when he brought them Our tokens, behold! they laughed at them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:48: And every token that We showed them was greater than its sister (token), and We grasped them with the torment, that haply they might turn again.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:49: And they said: O wizard! Entreat thy Lord for us by the pact that He hath made with thee.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:50: But when We eased them of the torment, behold! they broke their word.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:51: And Pharaoh caused a proclamation to be made among his people saying: O my people! Is not mine the sovereignty of Egypt and these rivers flowing under me ? Can ye not then discern ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:52: I am surely better than this fellow, who is despicable and can hardly make (his meaning) plain!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:53: Why, then, have armlets of gold not been set upon him, or angels sent along with him ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:54: Thus he persuaded his people to make light (of Moses), and they obeyed him.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:55: So, when they angered Us, We punished them and drowned them every one.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:56: And We made them a thing past, and an example for those after (them).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:57: And when the son of Mary is quoted as an example, behold! the folk laugh out,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:58: And say: Are our gods better, or is he ? They raise not the objection save for argument.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:59: He is nothing but a slave on whom We bestowed favour, and We made him a pattern for the Children of Israel.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:60: And had We willed We could have set among you angels to be viceroys in the earth.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:61: And lo! verily there is knowledge of the Hour.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:62: And let not Satan turn you aside.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:63: When Jesus came with clear proofs (of Allah’s Sovereignty), he said: I have come unto you with wisdom, and to make plain some of that concerning which ye differ.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:64: Lo! Allah, He is my Lord and your Lord.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:65: But the factions among them differed.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:66: Await they aught save the Hour, that it shall come upon them suddenly, when they know not ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:67: Friends on that day will be foes one to another, save those who kept their duty (to Allah).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:68: O My slaves! For you there is no fear this day, nor is it ye who grieve;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:69: (Ye) who believed Our revelations and were self-surrendered,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:70: Enter the Garden, ye and your wives, to be made glad.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:71: Therein are brought round for them trays of gold and goblets, and therein is all that souls desire and eyes find sweet.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:72: This is the Garden which ye are made to inherit because of what ye used to do.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:73: Therein for you is fruit in plenty whence to eat.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:74: Lo! the guilty are immortal in hell’s torment.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:75: It is not relaxed for them, and they despair therein.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:76: We wronged them not, but they it was who did the wrong.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:77: And they cry: O master! Let thy Lord make an end of us.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:78: We verily brought the Truth unto you, but ye were, most of you, averse to the Truth.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:79: Or do they determine any thing (against the Prophet) ? Lo! We (also) are determining.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:80: Or deem they that We cannot hear their secret thoughts and private confidences ? Nay, but Our envoys, present with them, do record.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:81: Say (O Muhammad): If the Beneficent One hath a son, then, I shall be first among the worshippers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:82: Glorified be the Lord of the heavens and the earth, the Lord of the Throne, from that which they ascribe (unto Him)!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:83: So let them flounder (in their talk) and play until they meet the Day which they are promised.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:84: And He it is Who in the heaven is God, and in the earth God.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:85: And blessed be He unto Whom belongeth the Sovereignty of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, and with Whom is knowledge of the Hour, and unto Whom ye will be returned.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:86: And those unto whom they cry instead of Him possess no power of intercession, saving him who beareth witness unto the Truth knowingly.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:87: And if thou ask them who created them, they will surely say: Allah.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:88: And he saith: O my Lord! Lo! these are a folk who believe not.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 43:89: Then bear with them (O Muhammad) and say: Peace.

Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:2: By the Book that makes things clear,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:3: We have made it a Qur’an in Arabic, that ye may be able to understand (and learn wisdom).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:4: And verily, it is in the Mother of the Book, in Our Presence, high (in dignity), full of wisdom.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:5: Shall We then take away the Message from you and repel (you), for that ye are a people transgressing beyond bounds?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:6: But how many were the prophets We sent amongst the peoples of old?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:7: And never came there a prophet to them but they mocked him.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:8: So We destroyed (them)- stronger in power than these;- and (thus) has passed on the Parable of the peoples of old.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:9: If thou wert to question them, ’Who created the heavens and the earth?’ They would be sure to reply, ’they were created by (Him), the Exalted in Power, Full of Knowledge’;-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:10: (Yea, the same that) has made for you the earth (like a carpet) spread out, and has made for you roads (and channels) therein, in order that ye may find guidance (on the way);
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:11: That sends down (from time to time) rain from the sky in due measure;- and We raise to life therewith a land that is dead; even so will ye be raised (from the dead);-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:12: That has created pairs in all things, and has made for you ships and cattle on which ye ride,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:13: In order that ye may sit firm and square on their backs, and when so seated, ye may celebrate the (kind) favour of your Lord, and say, "Glory to Him Who has subjected these to our (use), for we could never have accomplished this (by ourselves),
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:14: "And to our Lord, surely, must we turn back!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:15: Yet they attribute to some of His servants a share with Him (in his godhead)! truly is man a blasphemous ingrate avowed!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:16: What! has He taken daughters out of what He himself creates, and granted to you sons for choice?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:17: When news is brought to one of them of (the birth of) what he sets up as a likeness to (God) Most Gracious, his face darkens, and he is filled with inward grief!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:18: Is then one brought up among trinkets, and unable to give a clear account in a dispute (to be associated with God)?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:19: And they make into females angels who themselves serve God.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:20: ("Ah!") they say, "If it had been the will of (God) Most Gracious, we should not have worshipped such (deities)!" Of that they have no knowledge! they do nothing but lie!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:21: What! have We given them a Book before this, to which they are holding fast?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:22: Nay! they say: "We found our fathers following a certain religion, and we do guide ourselves by their footsteps.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:23: Just in the same way, whenever We sent a Warner before thee to any people, the wealthy ones among them said: "We found our fathers following a certain religion, and we will certainly follow in their footsteps.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:24: He said: "What! Even if I brought you better guidance than that which ye found your fathers following?" They said: "For us, we deny that ye (prophets) are sent (on a mission at all).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:25: So We exacted retribution from them: now see what was the end of those who rejected (Truth)!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:26: Behold! Abraham said to his father and his people: "I do indeed clear myself of what ye worship:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:27: "(I worship) only Him Who made me, and He will certainly guide me.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:28: And he left it as a Word to endure among those who came after him, that they may turn back (to God).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:29: Yea, I have given the good things of this life to these (men) and their fathers, until the Truth has come to them, and an apostle making things clear.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:30: But when the Truth came to them, they said: "This is sorcery, and we do reject it.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:31: Also, they say: "Why is not this Qur’an sent down to some leading man in either of the two (chief) cities?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:32: Is it they who would portion out the Mercy of thy Lord? It is We Who portion out between them their livelihood in the life of this world: and We raise some of them above others in ranks, so that some may command work from others.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:33: And were it not that (all) men might become of one (evil) way of life, We would provide, for everyone that blasphemes against (God) Most Gracious, silver roofs for their houses and (silver) stair-ways on which to go up,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:34: And (silver) doors to their houses, and thrones (of silver) on which they could recline,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:36: If anyone withdraws himself from remembrance of (God) Most Gracious, We appoint for him an evil one, to be an intimate companion to him.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:37: Such (evil ones) really hinder them from the Path, but they think that they are being guided aright!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:38: At length, when (such a one) comes to Us, he says (to his evil companion): "Would that between me and thee were the distance of East and West!" Ah! evil is the companion (indeed)!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:39: When ye have done wrong, it will avail you nothing, that Day, that ye shall be partners in Punishment!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:40: Canst thou then make the deaf to hear, or give direction to the blind or to such as (wander) in manifest error?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:41: Even if We take thee away, We shall be sure to exact retribution from them,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:42: Or We shall show thee that (accomplished) which We have promised them: for verily We shall prevail over them.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:43: So hold thou fast to the Revelation sent down to thee; verily thou art on a Straight Way.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:44: The (Qur’an) is indeed the message, for thee and for thy people; and soon shall ye (all) be brought to account.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:45: And question thou our apostles whom We sent before thee; did We appoint any deities other than (God) Most Gracious, to be worshipped?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:46: We did send Moses aforetime, with Our Signs, to Pharaoh and his Chiefs: He said, "I am an apostle of the Lord of the Worlds.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:47: But when he came to them with Our Signs, behold they ridiculed them.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:48: We showed them Sign after Sign, each greater than its fellow, and We seized them with Punishment, in order that they might turn (to Us).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:49: And they said, "O thou sorcerer! Invoke thy Lord for us according to His covenant with thee; for we shall truly accept guidance.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:50: But when We removed the Penalty from them, behold, they broke their word.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:51: And Pharaoh proclaimed among his people, saying: "O my people! Does not the dominion of Egypt belong to me, (witness) these streams flowing underneath my (palace)? What! see ye not then?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:52: "Am I not better than this (Moses), who is a contemptible wretch and can scarcely express himself clearly?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:53: "Then why are not gold bracelets bestowed on him, or (why) come (not) with him angels accompanying him in procession?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:54: Thus did he make fools of his people, and they obeyed him: truly were they a people rebellious (against God).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:55: When at length they provoked Us, We exacted retribution from them, and We drowned them all.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:56: And We made them (a people) of the Past and an Example to later ages.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:57: When (Jesus) the son of Mary is held up as an example, behold, thy people raise a clamour thereat (in ridicule)!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:58: And they say, "Are our gods best, or he?" This they set forth to thee, only by way of disputation: yea, they are a contentious people.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:59: He was no more than a servant: We granted Our favour to him, and We made him an example to the Children of Israel.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:60: And if it were Our Will, We could make angels from amongst you, succeeding each other on the earth.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:61: And (Jesus) shall be a Sign (for the coming of) the Hour (of Judgment): therefore have no doubt about the (Hour), but follow ye Me: this is a Straight Way.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:62: Let not the Evil One hinder you: for he is to you an enemy avowed.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:63: When Jesus came with Clear Signs, he said: "Now have I come to you with Wisdom, and in order to make clear to you some of the (points) on which ye dispute: therefore fear God and obey me.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:64: "For God, He is my Lord and your Lord: so worship ye Him: this is a Straight Way.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:65: But sects from among themselves fell into disagreement: then woe to the wrong-doers, from the Penalty of a Grievous Day!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:66: Do they only wait for the Hour - that it should come on them all of a sudden, while they perceive not?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:67: Friends on that day will be foes, one to another,- except the Righteous.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:68: My devotees! no fear shall be on you that Day, nor shall ye grieve,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:69: (Being) those who have believed in Our Signs and bowed (their wills to Ours) in Islam.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:70: Enter ye the Garden, ye and your wives, in (beauty and) rejoicing.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:71: To them will be passed round, dishes and goblets of gold: there will be there all that the souls could desire, all that their ayes could delight in: and ye shall abide therein (for eye).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:72: Such will be the Garden of which ye are made heirs for your (good) deeds (in life).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:73: Ye shall have therein abundance of fruit, from which ye shall have satisfaction.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:74: The sinners will be in the Punishment of Hell, to dwell therein (for aye):
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:75: Nowise will the (Punishment) be lightened for them, and in despair will they be there overwhelmed.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:76: Nowise shall We be unjust to them: but it is they who have been unjust themselves.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:77: They will cry: "O Malik! would that thy Lord put an end to us!" He will say, "Nay, but ye shall abide!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:78: Verily We have brought the Truth to you: but most of you have a hatred for Truth.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:79: What! have they settled some plan (among themselves)? But it is We Who settle things.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:80: Or do they think that We hear not their secrets and their private counsels? Indeed (We do), and Our messengers are by them, to record.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:81: Say: "If (God) Most Gracious had a son, I would be the first to worship.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:82: Glory to the Lord of the heavens and the earth, the Lord of the Throne (of Authority)! (He is free) from the things they attribute (to him)!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:83: So leave them to babble and play (with vanities) until they meet that Day of theirs, which they have been promised.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:84: It is He Who is God in heaven and God on earth; and He is full of Wisdom and Knowledge.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:85: And blessed is He to Whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth, and all between them: with Him is the Knowledge of the Hour (of Judgment): and to Him shall ye be brought back.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:86: And those whom they invoke besides God have no power of intercession;- only he who bears witness to the Truth, and they know (him).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:87: If thou ask them, who created them, they will certainly say, God: How then are they deluded away (from the Truth)?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:88: (God has knowledge) of the (Prophet’s) cry, "O my Lord! Truly these are people who will not believe!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 43:89: But turn away from them, and say "Peace!" But soon shall they know!

Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:3: behold, We have made it an Arabic Koran; haply you will understand;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:4: and behold, it is in the Essence of the Book, with Us; sublime indeed, wise.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:5: Shall We turn away the Remembrance from you, for that you are a prodigal people?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:6: How many a Prophet We sent among the ancients,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:7: but not a Prophet came to them, without they mocked at him;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:8: so We destroyed men stronger in valour than they, and the example of the ancients passed away.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:9: If thou askest them, ’Who created the heavens and earth?’ they will say, ’The All-mighty, the All-knowing created them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:10: He who appointed the earth to be a cradle for you, and appointed ways for you therein, that haply you may be guided;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:11: and who sent down out of heaven water in measure; and We revived thereby a land that was dead; even so you shall be brought forth;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:12: and who created the pairs, all of them, and appointed for you ships and cattle such as you ride,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:13: that you may be seated on their backs and then remember your Lord’s blessing when you are seated on them, and say, ’Glory be to Him, who has subjected this to us, and we ourselves were not equal to it;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:14: surely unto our Lord we are turning.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:15: Yet they have assigned to Him a part of His own servants! Man is dearly unthankful.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:16: Or has He taken to Himself, from that He creates, daughters, and favoured you with sons?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:17: And when any of them is given the good tidings of that he has likened to the All-merciful, his face is darkened, and he chokes inwardly.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:18: What, one who is reared amid ornaments and, when the time of altercation comes, is not to be seen?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:19: And they have made the angels, who are themselves servants of the All-merciful, females.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:20: They say, ’Had the All-merciful so willed, we would not have served them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:21: Or did We bring them a Book aforetime to which they hold?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:22: Nay, but they say, ’We found our fathers upon a community, and we are guided upon their traces.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:23: Even so We sent never before thee any warner into any city, except that its men who lived at ease said, ’We indeed found our fathers upon a community, and we are following upon their traces.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:24: Say: ’What, though I should bring you a better guidance than you found your fathers upon?’ They say, ’We disbelieve in that you were sent with.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:25: So We took vengeance upon them; and behold how was the end of them that cried lies.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:26: And when Abraham said to his father and his people, ’Surely I am quit of that you serve,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:27: except Him who originated me; and He will guide me.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:28: And he made it a word enduring among his posterity; haply so they would return.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:29: Nay, but I gave these and their fathers enjoyment of days, until the truth came unto them, and a manifest Messenger.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:30: And when the truth came to them, they said, ’This is a sorcery, and in it we are unbelievers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:31: They say, ’Why was this Koran not sent down upon some man of moment in the two cities?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:32: What, is it they who divide the mercy of the Lord? We have divided between them their livelihood in the present life, and raised some of them above others in rank, that some of them may take others in servitude; and the mercy of thy Lord is better than that they amass.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:33: And were it not that mankind would be one nation, We would have appointed for those who disbelieve in the All-merciful roofs of silver to their houses, and stairs whereon to mount,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:34: and doors to their houses, and couches whereon to recline,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:35: and ornaments; surely all this is but the enjoyment of the present life, and the world to come with thy Lord is for the godfearing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:36: Whoso blinds himself to the Remembrance of the All-merciful, to him We assign a Satan for comrade;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:37: and they bar them from the way, and they think they are guided,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:38: till, when he comes to Us, he says, ’Would there had been between me and thee the distance of the two Easts!’ An evil comrade!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:39: It shall not profit you today, since you did evil, that you are partners in the chastisement.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:40: What, shalt thou make the deaf to hear, or shalt thou guide the blind and him who is in manifest error?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:41: Whether We take thee away, We shall take vengeance upon them,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:42: or We show thee a part of that We promised them, surely We have power over them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:43: So hold thou fast unto that which has been revealed unto thee; surely thou art upon a straight path.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:44: Surely it is a Reminder to thee and to thy people; and assuredly you will be questioned.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:45: Ask those of Our Messengers We sent before thee: Have We appointed, apart from the All-merciful, gods to be served?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:46: We also sent Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his Council, and he said, ’Surely, I am the Messenger of the Lord of all Being.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:47: But when he brought them Our signs, lo, they laughed at them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:48: And not a sign We showed them, but it was greater than its sister sign; and We seized them with chastisement, that haply they should return.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:49: And they said, ’Sorcerer, pray to thy Lord for us by the covenant He has made with thee, and surely we shall be right-guided.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:50: But when We removed from them the chastisement, behold, they broke their troth.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:51: And Pharaoh proclaimed among his people: ’O my people, do I not possess the kingdom of Egypt, and these rivers flowing beneath me? What, do you not see?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:52: Or am I better than this man, who is contemptible and scarcely makes things clear?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:53: Why then have bracelets of gold not been cast on him, or angels not come with him conjoined?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:54: So he made his people unsteady, and they obeyed him; surely they were an ungodly people.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:55: So, when they had angered Us, We took vengeance on them, and We drowned them all together;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:56: and We made them a thing past, and We appointed them for an example to later folk.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:57: And when the son of Mary is cited as an example, behold, thy people turn away from it
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:58: and say, ’What, are our gods better, or he?’ They cite not him to thee, save to dispute;.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:59: He is only a servant We blessed, and We made him to be an example to the Children of Israel.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:60: Had We willed, We would have appointed angels among you to be successors in the earth.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:61: It is knowledge of the Hour; doubt not concerning it, and follow me.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:62: Let not Satan bar you; he is for you a manifest foe.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:63: And when Jesus came with the clear signs he said, ’I have come to you with wisdom, and that I may make clear to you some of that whereon you are at variance; so fear you God and obey you me.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:64: Assuredly God is my Lord and your Lord; therefore serve Him; this is a straight path.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:65: But the parties among them fell into variance; so woe unto those who did evil, because of the chastisement of a painful day.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:66: Are they looking for aught but the Hour, that it shall come upon them suddenly, when they are not aware?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:67: Friends on that day shall be foes to one another, but the god-fearing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:68: ’O My servants, today no fear is on you, neither do you sorrow’ --
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:69: even those who believed in Our signs, and had surrendered themselves
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:70: ’Enter Paradise, you and your wives, walking with joy!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:71: There shall be passed around them platters of gold, and cups, therein being whatever the souls desire, and the eyes delight in.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:72: This is the Paradise that you have been given for an inheritance for the things that you were doing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:73: Therein you have abundant fruits, whereof you may eat.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:74: But the evildoers dwell forever in the chastisement of Gehenna
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:75: that is not abated for them and therein they are sore confounded.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:76: We never wronged them, but they themselves did the wrong.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:77: And they shall call, ’O Malik, let thy Lord have done with us!’ He will say, ’You will surely tarry.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:78: ’We brought you the truth, but most of you were averse to the truth.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:79: Or have they contrived some matter? We too are contriving.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:80: Or do they think We hear not their secret and what they conspire together? Yes indeed, and Our messengers are present with them writing it down.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:81: Say: ’If the All-merciful has a son, then I am the first to serve him.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:82: Glory be to the Lord of the heavens and the earth, the Lord of the Throne, above that they describe.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:83: Then leave them alone to plunge and play, until they encounter that day of theirs which they are promised.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:84: And it is He who in heaven is God and in earth is God; He is the All-wise, the All-knowing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:85: Glory be to Him, to whom belongs the Kingdom of the heavens and the earth and all that between them is; with Him is the knowledge of the Hour, and to Him you shall be returned.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:86: Those they call upon, apart from Him, have no power of intercession, save such as have testified to the truth, and that knowingly.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:87: If thou askest them, ’Who created you?’ they will say, ’God.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:88: And for his saying, ’My Lord, surely these are a people who believe not’ --
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 43:89: yet pardon them, and say, ’Peace!’ Soon they will know.

Muhammad Asad.verse 43:2: CONSIDER this divine writ, clear in itself and clearly showing the truth:
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:3: behold, We have caused it to be a discourse in the Arabic tongue, so that you might encompass it with your reason.
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:4: And, verily, [originating as it does] in the source, with Us, of all revelation, it is indeed sublime, full of wisdom.
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:5: [O YOU who deny the truth!] Should We, perchance, withdraw this reminder from you altogether, seeing that you are people bent on wasting your own selves?
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:6: And how many a prophet did We send to people of olden times!
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:7: But never yet came a prophet to them without their deriding him –
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:8: and so, [in the end,] We destroyed them [even though they were] of greater might than these: and the
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:9: image of those people of old became a thing of the past.
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:10: Yet thus it is [with most people]: if thou ask them, "Who is it that has created the heavens and the earth?" – they will surely answer, "The Almighty, the All-Knowing has created them.
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:11: He it is who has made the earth a cradle for you, and has provided for you ways [of livelihood] thereon, so that you might follow the right path.
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:12: And He it is who sends down, again and again, waters from the sky in due measure: and
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:13: We raise therewith dead land to life, even thus will you be brought forth [from the dead].
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:14: And He it is who has created all opposites.
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:15: in order that you might gain mastery over them, and that, whenever you have mastered them, you might remember your Sustainer’s blessings and say: "Limitless in His glory is He who has made
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:16: this subservient to our use – since [but for Him,] we would not have been able to attain to it.
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:17: Hence, verily, it is unto our Sustainer that we must always turn.
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:18: AND YET, they attribute to Him offspring from among some of the beings created by Him! Verily, most obviously bereft of all gratitude is man!
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:19: Or [do you think], perchance, that out of all His creation He has chosen for Himself daughters, and favoured you with sons?
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:20: For [thus it is:] if any of them is given the glad tiding of [the birth of] what he so readily attributes to the Most Gracious, his face darkens, and he is filled with suppressed anger:
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:21: "What! [Am I to have a daughter –] one who is to be reared
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:22: for the sake of ornament?" – and thereupon he finds himself torn by a vague inner conflict.
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:24: they claim that the angels – who in themselves are but beings created by the Most Gracious – are females:
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:25: did they witness their creation? This false claim of theirs will be recorded, and they will be called to account [for it on Judgment Day]!
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:27: the Most Gracious so willed, we would never have worshipped them!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:28: they cannot have any knowledge of [His having willed] such a thing: they do nothing but guess.
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:29: Or have We, perchance, vouchsafed them, before this one, a revelation [to the contrary,] to which they are still holding fast?
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:30: Nay, but they say, "Behold, We found our forefathers agreed on what to believe – and, verily, it is in their footsteps that we find our guidance!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:31: And thus it is: whenever We sent, before thy time, a warner to any community, those of its people who had lost themselves entirely in the pursuit of pleasures would always say, "Behold, we found our forefathers agreed on what to believe – and, verily, it is but in their footsteps that we follow!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:32: [Whereupon each prophet] would say, "Why, even though I bring you a guidance better than that which you found your forefathers believing in?" – [to which] the others would reply, "Behold, we deny that there is any truth in [what you claim to be] your messages!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:33: And so We inflicted Our retribution on them: and behold what happened in the end to those who gave the lie to the truth!
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:34: AND WHEN Abraham spoke to his father and his people, [he had this very truth in mind:] "Verily, far be it from me to worship what you worship!
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:35: None [do I worship] but Him who has brought me into being: and, behold, it is He who will guide me!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:36: And he uttered this as a word destined to endure among those who would come after him, so that they might
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:38: Now [as for those who did come after him,] I allowed them – as [I had allowed] their forebears – to enjoy their lives freely until the truth should come unto them through an apostle who would make all things clear:
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:39: but now that the truth has come to them, they say, "All this is mere spellbinding eloquence – and, behold, we deny that there is any truth in it!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:40: And they say, too, "Why was not this Qur’ān bestowed from on high on some great man of the two cities?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:41: But is it they who distribute thy Sustainer’s grace? [Nay, as] it is We who distribute their means of livelihood among them in the life of this world, and raise some of them by degrees above others, to the end that they might avail themselves of one another’s help – [so, too, it is We who bestow gifts of the spirit upon whomever We will]: and this thy Sustainer’s grace is better than all [the worldly wealth] that they may amass.
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:42: And were it not that [with the prospect of boundless riches before them] all people would become one
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:43: community, We might indeed have provided for those who
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:44: deny the Most Gracious roofs of silver for their houses, and
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:50: enjoyment of life in this world – whereas [happiness in] the life to come awaits the God-conscious with thy Sustainer.
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:51: But as for anyone who chooses to remain blind to the remembrance of the Most Gracious, to him We assign an
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:52: evil impulse, to become his other self:
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:53: whereupon, behold, these [evil impulses] bar all such from the path [of truth], making them think that they are guided aright!
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:54: But in the end, when he [who has thus sinned] appears before us [on Judgment Day], he will say [to his other self], "Would that between me and thee there had been the distance of east and west!" – for evil indeed [has proved] that other self!
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:55: On that Day it will not profit you in the least [to know] that, since you have sinned ,
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:56: you are now to share your suffering [as well].
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:57: CANST THOU, perchance, [O Muhammad,] make the deaf hear, or show the right way to the blind or to such as are obviously lost in error?
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:58: But whether We do [or do not] take thee away [ere thy message prevails] – verily, We shall inflict Our retribution on them;
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:59: and whether We show thee [or do not show thee in this world] the fulfilment of what We have promised them – verily, We have full power over them!
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:60: So hold fast to all that has been revealed to thee: for, behold, thou art on a straight way;
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:62: shall indeed become [a source of] eminence for thee and thy people: but in time you all will be called to account [for what you have done with it].
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:63: Yet [above all else,] ask any of Our apostles whom We sent forth before thy time whether We have ever allowed that deities other than the Most Gracious be worshipped!
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:64: THUS, INDEED, have We sent Moses with Our messages unto Pharaoh and his great ones; and he said: "Behold, I am an apostle of the Sustainer of all the worlds!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:65: But as soon as he came before them with Our
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:67: although each sign that We showed them was weightier than the preceding one: and [each time] We took them to task through suffering, so that they might return [to Us].
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:68: And [every time] they exclaimed: "O thou sorcerer! Pray for us to thy Sustainer on the strength of the covenant [of prophethood] which He has made with thee: for, verily, we shall now follow the right way!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:69: But whenever We removed the suffering from them, lo! they would break their word.
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:70: And Pharaoh issued a call to his people, saying: "O my people! Does not the dominion over Egypt belong to me, since all these running waters flow at my feet? Can you not, then, see [that I am your lord supreme]?
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:71: Am I not better than this contemptible man who can hardly make his meaning clear?
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:72: "And then – why have no golden armlets been bestowed on him? – or why have no angels come together with him?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:73: Thus he incited his people to levity, and they obeyed him: for, behold, they were people depraved!
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:74: But when they continued to challenge Us, We inflicted Our retribution on them, and drowned them all:
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:75: and so We made them a thing of the past, and an example to those who would come after them.
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:76: NOW WHENEVER [the nature of] the son of Mary is set forth as an example, [O Muhammad,] lo! thy people raise an outcry on this score,
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:77: and say, "Which is better – our deities or he?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:78: it is only in the spirit of dispute that they put this comparison before thee: yea, they are contentious folk!
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:79: [As for Jesus,] he was nothing but [a human being –] a servant [of Ours] whom We had graced [with prophethood], and whom We made an example for the children of Israel.
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:80: And had We so willed, [O you who worship angels,] We could indeed have made you into angels succeeding one another on earth!
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:81: AND, BEHOLD, this [divine writ] is indeed a means to know
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:82: the Last Hour [is bound to come]; hence, have no doubt whatever about it, but follow Me: this
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:84: And let not Satan bar you [from it] – for, verily, he is your open foe!
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:85: NOW WHEN Jesus came [to his people] with all evidence of the truth, he said: "I have now come unto you with wisdom, and to make clear unto you some of that on which you are at variance: hence, be conscious of God, and pay heed unto me.
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:86: "Verily, God is my Sustainer as well as your Sustainer; so worship [none but] Him: this
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:88: But factions from among those [who came after Jesus] began to hold divergent views: woe, then, unto those who are bent on evildoing –
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:89: for the suffering [that will befall them] on a grievous Day!
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:90: ARE THEY [who are lost in sin] but waiting for the Last Hour –
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:91: that it come upon them of a sudden, without their being aware [of its approach]?
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:93: friends will be foes unto one another –
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:95: [And God will say:] "O you servants of Mine! No fear need you have today, and neither shall you grieve –
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:96: [O you] who have attained to faith in Our messages and have surrendered your own selves unto Us!
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:97: Enter paradise, you and your spouses, with happiness blest!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:98: [And there] they will be waited upon with trays and goblets of gold; and there will be found all that the souls might desire, and [all that] the eyes might delight in.
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:99: for such will be the paradise which you shall have inherited by virtue of your past deeds:
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:100: fruits [of those deeds] shall you have in abundance,
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:103: behold, they who are lost in sin shall abide in the suffering of hell:
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:104: it will not be lightened for them; and therein they will be lost in hopeless despair.
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:105: And it is not We who will be doing wrong unto them, but it is they who will have wronged themselves.
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:107: who rules [over hell]! Let thy Sustainer put an end to us!" –
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:108: he will reply: "Verily, you must live on [in this state].
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:109: INDEED, [O you sinners,] We have conveyed the truth unto you; but most of you abhor the truth.
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:110: Why – can they [who deny the truth ever] determine what [the truth] should be?
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:111: for behold it is We who determine .
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:112: Or do they, perchance, think that We do not hear their hidden thoughts and their secret confabulations? Yea, indeed, [We do,] and Our heavenly forces are with them, recording .
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:114: had a son, I would be the first to worship him!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:115: Utterly remote, in His glory, is the Sustainer of the heavens and the earth – the Sustainer, in almightiness enthroned – from all that they may attribute to Him by way of definition!
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:116: But leave them to indulge in idle talk and play [with words] until they face that
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:117: Day of theirs which they have been promised:
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:118: for [then they will come to know that] it is He
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:119: who is God in heaven and God on earth, and
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:120: He alone is truly wise, all-knowing.
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:121: And hallowed be He unto whom the dominion over the heavens and the earth and all that is between them belongs, and with whom the knowledge of the Last Hour rests, and unto whom you all shall be brought back!
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:123: whom some invoke beside God have it not in their power to intercede [on Judgment Day] for any but such as have [in their lifetime] borne witness to the truth, and have been aware [that God is one and unique].
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:124: ) Now if thou ask those [who worship any being other than God] as to who it is that has created them, they are sure to answer, "God.
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:125: [But God has full knowledge of the true believer] and of his
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:126: cry: "O my Sustainer! Verily, these are people who will not believe!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 43:127: Yet bear thou with them, and say, "Peace [be upon you]!" – for in time they will come to know [the truth].
