Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:3: We have made it an Arabic Qur’ān, so that you may understand.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:4: And it is, in the Mother of the Book (the Preserved Tablet) with us, surely sublime, full of wisdom.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:5: Shall We then take the advice away from you because you are a transgressing people?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:6: How many a messenger We have sent to the earlier people!
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:7: No messenger came to them, but they used to mock at him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:8: So We have destroyed those who were stronger than these (people of Makkah) in power, and the example of the earlier people has already passed.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:9: Should you ask them as to who has created the heavens and the earth, they will certainly say, “They are created by the All-Mighty, the All-Knowing,”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:10: the One who has made the earth a cradle for you, and has made for you pathways therein, so that you may be guided,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:11: and the One who has sent down water from the sky in due measure.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:12: and the One who has created all the pairs, and has made for you the boats and the cattle that you ride,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:13: so that you may mount upon their back, then recall the favour of your Lord after having mounted upon it and say, “Pure is the One who has subjugated this for us, and We were not able to have control over it,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:14: and of course, towards our Lord we have to return.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:15: They have attributed to Him (that He is composed of) parts, (and that too) out of His servants.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:16: Is it that He has adopted daughters from those whom He has created, and chosen you for (having) sons?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:17: When one of them is given the good news of (the birth of) that which he has attributed to RaHmān (i.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:18: Is it that (Allah has chosen) those (as His offspring) who are grown up in ornaments and who cannot express themselves in debate clearly?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:19: They have held angels, who are the servants of RaHmān, as females.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:20: They say, “Had the RaHmān so willed, we would not have worshipped them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:21: Or have We given to them a book before this, and they are adhering to it?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:22: Instead, they say, “We have found our fathers on a certain way, and we are on their footprints, fully guided.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:23: Similarly, We did not send a warner to a town before you, but its affluent people said, “We have found our fathers on a certain way, and we are following their footprints.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:24: He said, “Even if I bring to you something better in guidance than that on which you have found your fathers?” They said, “We totally disbelieve in what you are sent with.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:25: So, We took revenge from them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:26: (Recall) when Ibrāhīm said to his father and to his people, “I disown that which you worship,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:27: except the One who has originated me; so He will guide me.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:28: He made it a word lasting among his posterity, so that they may return.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:29: But, I gave these and their fathers enjoyment, until the truth came to them, and a messenger as well who explains (it).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:30: But when the truth came to them, they said, “This is magic, and we totally disbelieve in it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:31: They say, “Why was this Qur’ān not revealed on a great man from (either of) the two towns?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:32: Is it they who allocate the mercy of your Lord? We have allocated among them their livelihood in the worldly life, and have raised some of them over others in ranks, so that some of them may put some others to work.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:33: Were it not that all people would become of a single creed (i.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:34: and doors of their homes, and the coaches on which they would recline,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:35: and (would have made some of these things) of gold-ornaments.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:36: Whoever makes himself blind against the advice of RaHmān, We assign for him a devil who accompanies him all the time.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:37: And they (the devils) prevent such people from the (right) way, while they deem themselves to be on the right path,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:38: until when such a person will come to us, he will say (to the devil), “Would that there were the distance of East and West between me and you, because you were the worst companion.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:39: And (it will be said to such people,) “Since you were wrongdoers, it will never benefit you today that you are sharing the punishment with each other.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:40: So, can you (O prophet) make the deaf to hear, or can you show the way to the blind and the one who is in open error?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:41: So, even if We take you away, We will surely take vengeance on them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:42: Or (if) We show you (in your life) that (punishment) with which We have threatened them, then We have full control over them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:43: So, hold fast to that which has been revealed to you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:44: And certainly this (Qur’ān) is a word of honour for you and your people, and you will be questioned.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:45: Ask Our messengers whom We sent before you whether We had appointed gods to be worshipped besides RaHmān.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:46: We sent Mūsā with Our signs to Fir’aun (Pharaoh) and his chiefs; so he said, “I am the messenger of the Lord of the worlds.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:47: So, when he came to them with Our signs, they at once started laughing at them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:48: And We did not show them a sign, but it used to be greater than the one that preceded it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:49: And they said, “O magician, pray for us to your Lord by the covenant He has made with you; we will certainly come to guidance.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:50: Then, once We removed the punishment from them, in no time they broke their promise.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:51: And Fir’aun (Pharaoh) proclaimed among his people, saying, “Does not the kingdom of Egypt belong to me, and these rivers are flowing right underneath me? Do you, then, not discern?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:52: Or (do you not see that) I am much better than this one (Mūsā) who is worthless and can hardly express himself?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:53: So why were the bracelets of gold not sent down to him, or (why) did the angels not come along with him as companions?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:54: Thus he made fool of his people, and they obeyed him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:55: So, when they provoked Our anger, We took vengeance on them, and drowned them all together,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:56: and made them a people of the past, and an example for the later generations.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:57: When the example of the son of Maryam was cited, your people started at once shouting at it (in joy),
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:58: and said, “Are Our gods better or is he?” They did not cite it (the example) but for the sake of disputation.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:59: He (‘Īsā) is no more than a servant (of Allah) whom We favoured and made an example for the children of Isrā’īl.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:60: And if We will, We may create angels from you who succeed you on the earth.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:61: And he (‘Īsā) is a source of knowledge of the Hour (the Day of Judgment); so do not be in doubt about it, and follow me.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:62: And let not the ShaiTān (Satan) prevent you (from following this way).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:63: When ‘Īsā came with clear proofs, he said, “I have come to you with wisdom, and to explain to you some of those matters in which you differ.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:64: Surely, it is Allah who is my Lord and your Lord; so worship Him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:65: Then different groups, out of them, fell into disagreement.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:66: They are waiting for nothing but for the Hour to come upon them suddenly, while they would not even imagine (it).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:67: Friends, on that day, will become enemies to one another, except the God-fearing,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:68: (to whom it will be said) “O my servants, there is no fear for you today, nor will you grieve-
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:69: -O those (servants) who believed in Our signs, and remained obedient.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:70: - Enter the Paradise, you and your spouses, showered with bliss.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:71: Circulated among them will be the bowls of gold, and glasses.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:72: That is the Paradise you are made to inherit because of what you used to do.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:73: For you there are fruits in abundance from which you will eat.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:74: The sinners (on the other hand) will be in the punishment of Jahannam (Hell), living there forever.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:75: It will not be lightened for them, and they will be there, devoid of all hopes.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:76: We did not do injustice to them, rather, they themselves were the unjust.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:77: And they will call (Mālik, the keeper of the Hell,) “O Mālik, let your Lord do away with us.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:78: (O disbelievers,) indeed We have brought to you the truth, but it is the truth that most of you detest.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:79: Is it that they have firmly resolved to do something (harmful to Our messenger)? Then, We have firmly resolved (to frustrate their plan.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:80: Do they think that We do not hear their secrets and their whispers? Yes of course, Our messengers (angels) are with them who record (whatever they plan).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:81: Say, “Had there been a son for the RaHmān, I would have been the first to worship.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:82: Pure is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, the Lord of the Throne, from what they attribute (to Him).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:83: So, let them indulge (in their fallacy) and play, until they face their Day that they are promised.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:84: He is the One who is God to be worshipped in the sky, and God to be worshipped on the earth.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:85: Glorious is the One to whom belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth and whatever lies between them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:86: And those whom they invoke besides Him have no power to intercede; but those who bear witness to the truth, while they have knowledge (may intercede for the believers with Allah’s permission).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:87: And if you ask them as to who has created them, they will certainly say, “Allah”.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:88: And (Allah has the knowledge) of his (prophet’s) saying, “O my Lord, these are a people who do not believe.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 43:89: So, turn away from them, and say, “Salām !” (good-bye!).

Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:3: Lo! We have made it an Arabic Qur’ān that perhaps you may understand.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:4: And it is indeed in the Mother Book, [which is] with Us [and it is] indeed exalted.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:5: Shall We turn away from you the Remembrance, utterly because you are a profligate folk?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:6: And how many a prophet did We send among the ancients!
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:7: And never did a prophet come to them but that they used to deride him.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:8: So We destroyed those who were mightier than them in prowess, and
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:9: there passed the example of the ancients.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:10: And if you ask them, ‘Who created the heavens and the earth?’ they will surely say, ‘The Mighty, the Knower created them’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:11: He Who made the earth a cradle for you, and placed for you therein ways, that perhaps you may be guided,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:12: and Who sent down water from the heaven in measure, and We revived with it a dead land.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:13: and Who created the pairs all of them, and made for you ships and cattle on which you ride,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:14: that you may sit upon their backs; and then remember your Lord’s grace when you are settled on them, and say, ‘Glory be to Him Who has disposed this for us, and we
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:15: ourselves were no match for it.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:16: And indeed it is to our Lord that we shall return’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:17: And they assign to Him from among His own servants a part.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:18: Or He has adopted, from all that He has created daughters, and preferred you with sons?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:19: And when one of them is given the good tidings of that which he has attributed to the Compassionate One, his face becomes darkened, and he chokes inwardly.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:20: What! one that is brought up amid trinkets and is incoherent in a dispute?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:21: And they have made the angels, who are themselves servants of the Compassionate One, females.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:22: And they say, ‘Had the Compassionate One
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:23: willed, we would not have worshipped them’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:24: Or have We brought them a scripture before, so that they are holding fast to it?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:25: Nay, but they say, ‘Lo! we found our fathers following a
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:26: creed and we are indeed in their footsteps to be guided’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:27: And thus We never sent a warner before you into any city without that its affluent folk said: ‘Lo! we found our fathers following a
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:29: we are indeed following in their footsteps’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:30: Say: ‘What! even if I bring you a better [means to] guidance than what you found your fathers following?’ They say, ‘Lo! we disbelieve in what you are sent with’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:31: So We took vengeance on them; behold then how was the sequel for the deniers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:32: And when Abraham said to his father and his people, ‘Surely I am innocent of that which you worship,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:33: except Him Who originated me; for He will indeed guide me’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:34: And he made it a word enduring among his posterity that perhaps they might recant.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:35: Nay, but I have let these and their fathers enjoy
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:36: until there came to them the truth, and a messenger who makes
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:38: But when the truth came to them, they said, ‘This is sorcery, and we are indeed disbelievers in it’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:39: And they said, ‘If only this Qur’ān had been revealed to some great man from the two towns!’
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:40: Is it they who apportion the mercy of your Lord? We have apportioned among them their livelihood in the life of this world, and raised some of them above others by degrees, so that some of them may take others in service, and the mercy of your Lord is better than what they amass.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:41: And were it not [for the danger] that mankind would be one community, We would have made, for those who disbelieve in the Compassionate One, roofs of silver for their houses and stairs by which they ascend,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:42: and doors for their houses, and couches on which they recline,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:44: enjoyment of the life of this world, and the Hereafter with your Lord is for the God-fearing.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:45: And whoever withdraws from the Remembrance of the Compassionate One, We assign for him a devil and he becomes his companion.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:46: And indeed they bar them from the way, while they suppose that they are
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:48: until when he comes to Us, he says: ‘O would that there were between me and you the distance of the two easts!’ — What an evil companion then!
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:49: And it will not benefit you this day, given that you did wrong that you will be sharing in the chastisement.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:50: Can you, then, make the deaf hear, or can you guide the blind and one who is in manifest error?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:51: So if We take you away, then We will take vengeance on them,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:52: or We show you that which We have promised them, for surely We have power over them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:53: So hold fast to that which has been revealed to you; surely you are on a straight path.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:54: And it is indeed a Reminder for you and for your people.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:56: And ask those of Our messengers whom We sent before you: Did We
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:57: appoint, besides the Compassionate One, gods to be worshipped?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:58: And verily We sent Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his council, and he said, ‘I am indeed the messenger of the Lord of the Worlds’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:59: But when he brought them Our signs, behold! they laughed at them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:60: And We never showed them a sign, but it was greater than the one before it.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:61: And they said, ‘O sorcerer! supplicate your Lord for us by the covenant that He has made with you.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:62: But as soon as We relieved them from the chastisement, behold! they had broken their pledge.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:63: And Pharaoh proclaimed among his people, ‘O my people, does not the kingdom of Egypt belong to me, and these rivers flowing beneath me? Do you not perceive?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:64: Or am I not better than this one, who is contemptible, and who can scarcely speak clearly?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:65: Why then have bracelets of gold not been cast on him or the angels not come with him one after the other?’
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:66: Thus did he persuade his people and they obeyed him.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:67: So when they had angered Us, We took vengeance on them and drowned them all.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:68: And We made them a thing past, and an example for others.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:69: And when the son of Mary is cited as an example, behold! your people laugh at it.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:70: And they say, ‘Are our gods better or he?’ They only cite this to you for the sake of contention.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:71: He is only a servant [of Ours] on whom We bestowed favour, and We made him an exemplar for the Children of Israel.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:72: And had We willed, We would have appointed among you angels to be
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:74: And indeed he is a portent of the Hour so do not doubt it but: ‘Follow me.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:75: And do not let Satan bar you.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:76: And when Jesus came with the clear signs, he said, ‘Verily I have brought you wisdom, and [I have come] to make clear to you some of what you are at variance over.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:77: Assuredly God is my Lord and your Lord; so worship Him — that is a straight path’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:78: But the factions differed among themselves.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:79: Are they awaiting anything, but that Hour should come upon them suddenly, while they are unaware?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:80: Friends will, on that day, be foes of one another, except for the God-fearing.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:81: ‘O My servants, there is no fear for you this day, nor will you grieve,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:82: those who believed in Our signs and had submitted themselves [to Me].
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:83: Enter Paradise, you and your spouses to be made joyful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:84: They will be served from all around with
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:85: dishes of gold and goblets and therein will be whatever souls desire and eyes delight in, and you will abide in it .
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:86: And that is the Paradise which you have been given to inherit [as the reward] for what you used to do.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:87: Therein are abundant fruits for you, from which you will eat’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:90: it will not be lightened for them and they will be
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:92: And We never wronged them, but they themselves were the wrongdoers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:93: And they will call out, ‘O Mālik, let your Lord finish us off!’ He will say, ‘You will surely remain!’
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:94: ‘Verily We brought you the truth, but most of you were averse to the truth’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:95: Or have they contrived some matter? For We
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:97: Or do they reckon that We do not hear their secret thoughts and their conspiring? Yes indeed! and Our messengers are with them keeping a record.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:98: Say: ‘If the Compassionate One had a son, I would have been first among the worshippers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:99: Glory be to the Lord of the heavens and the earth, the Lord of the Throne above what they allege!’
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:100: So leave them to indulge and play, until they encounter that day of theirs which they are promised.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:101: And He it is Who in the heaven is God, and in the earth is God; and He is the Wise, the Knower.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:102: And Blessed be He to Whom belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them; and with Him is the knowledge of the Hour, and to Him they will
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:104: And those whom they call on besides Him have no power of intercession, except those who bear witness to the truth with
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:106: And if you ask them who created them, they will surely say, ‘God’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 43:108: for his saying: ‘O my Lord! These are indeed a people who have no faith’.
